lexUnit.name: spill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flow over the edge of its container.

sentence.text: Stark coughed , a sticky flux of phlegm and blood spilling over his lips .
Tidal action prevented the oil , which spilled from the Cypriot-registered MV Worthy , from washing into the Solent .
More than 400 birds were coated with oil when 50 tonnes of crude oil spilled out from an opened valve as the Cypriot-registered tanker Worthy discharged her cargo at Fawley Refinery .

A heavy south easterly swell rolling in through the wide sounds to the north of Bressay threw Venturous on her beam ends several times , so much so that fuel oil spilled over through the deck breather pipes .
During each summer 's rainy season , the lake 's waters would spill over its southern rim and slide down towards Florida Bay .
He very much wanted to sip the water which stood beside him on the table , but his hands were shaking too much and the water would have spilled .
Inevitably the road worsened as we neared the pass , the surface rutted by trucks and still awash with water spilling down steep gullies .
Explain that the marbles have taken the place of the water that has spilled out .
If there is a blockage somewhere in the downpipe , water will spill out of the gutter .
Christopher jerked back and kicked , and the bowl of water spilt into the chair , over his legs and over Alan .
The light from the hall spilled across the multi-coloured counterpane , and he laid her gently in the middle .
Some of the wine spilled from the bottle to the floor .
Savoury juices spill from their ornate crusts ,
After a while , coffee spilled from the cup onto his toes and he opened his eyes .
Melissa touched her arm ; still she did not move but as if a tap had been opened , tears spilt from her eyes and began streaming down her face .
Shafts of moonlight spilled from the windows in the roof .
The smell of stale beer and cigarette smoke spilled into the back-stage corridors as we groped along in search of my dressing room .
Yards of video tape spilled onto the deck , along with pieces of broken plastic .
She gave him the cup ; a little had spilled in the saucer , because her hand was n't quite steady .
The area was sprayed with water to ` fume down " the acid , which spilled at about 9.20am .
He banged the table with his fist and the glasses jumped and the drink spilled .
` You knew , did n't you , " he said , noticing that his hands were shaking when some of the whisky spilt .
Frequently when the horses had finished eating they would get the bucket out of the tire and search for any grain that might have spilled underneath .
